intro: Ctenitis glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular tree fern, is a species native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its glossy, dark green leaves and a crown of spore-producing structures at the top. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. The plant's unique morphology and ecological role make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
